title.narrative: Caritas Brasileira Institutional Strengthening of Environment, Risk Management and Emergencies Dept.

description.narrative:
The project aims to strengthen the performance of the Caritas Brasileira (CB) Network in their emergency responses, via three main strategies: 1) to strengthen technical support in emergencies; 2) to train Caritas staff and volunteers to respond to emergencies; and 3) strengthen the knowledge management of the Network in its work with the MAGRE department (Environment, Risk Management and Emergencies), especially in the context of emergencies.
The project aims to achieve: 1) the greater presence and performance of the Caritas Network in Brazil in emergencies; 2) the training of at least 100 Caritas staff and volunteers in the use of network instruments to act in emergencies; and 3) the structuring of a MAGRE module in Caritas' online system (SI) that can respond to the needs of the Network re. emergencies while integrating staff and volunteers from areas where there is limited access to the internet.
Between 2020-22, CAFOD has supported CB to successfully carry out 7 emergency projects, and the volatile political, environmental and health context mean that Brazil is likely to continue to face further emergencies throughout 2022 and beyond. The publication of the 5th IPCC report, the 2021 Climate Summit and COP26 all point to future climatic disasters, and recent research by the journal, ‘Nature Climate Change’, shows that ‘the Amazon is approaching a tipping point… after which the rainforest would be lost with “profound” implications for the global climate and biodiversity.' This project therefore aims to invest in CB's capacity for the next two years, by tackling three main problems: 1) lack of a national reference in the Network for action with emergencies; 2) little or no use of the available instruments of the Network by Caritas staff and volunteers working in emergencies; and 3) lack of a reference system for the Network that centralises the flow of information during an emergency while being easy to use and based on everyday popular language.
